title: Project Management Coordinator
job_overview:
Join Our Team and Coordinate the Moving Parts Behind Every Event

About The Recording Service
We’re an AV crew that shows up ready to work. We handle the gear, the setup, and everything else it takes to pull off an event. Big or small, in-person or online, we’re early, reliable, and make sure everything’s locked in before showtime. We partner with universities, nonprofits, and production teams to bring stories to life through live events, video, and streaming. Behind every successful project is a clear plan — and that’s where you come in.

Role Overview: Project Management Coordinator
Type: Part-time (a chance of moving to full-time) 
Work Arrangement: Work from Home
Time in and out: Around 8:00 pm to 2:00 am (PH Time)  
Compensation: USD 5.00 - 6.00/hour depending on experience
Start Date: Flexible, last week July or August 2025

What You’ll Do
Write proposals
Communicate with clients and Atlanta crew through email or call
Create and manage schedules and crew calls
Update database from time to time
Document and communicate client needs clearly to tech teams
Coordinate and provide reports to exec, finance, production, and post production
Perform other tasks that may assigned by the manager

What We’re Looking For
2+ years of experience in project coordination, event planning, or operations (AV/production background a plus)
Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple timelines at once
Strong written and verbal communication. Call center experience is a plus! 
Calm under pressure, solutions-oriented, and collaborative
Comfortable with project management tools (we use Google Workspace, Notion, etc.)

Why This Role Matters

Every AV project is a mix of planning, teamwork, and decision-making. You’ll be the glue holding those pieces together—ensuring projects move smoothly from quote to wrap-up, and that clients feel heard every step of the way. If you love bringing structure to creative work, this role is for you.
